meanings.sent1: She prenominated her favorite book for the book club.
meanings.sent2: The teacher prenominated the student council members before the school year started.
meanings.sent3: The cat prenominated the best sleeping spot by the sunny window.
meanings.sent4: The early bird prenominated the juiciest worm in the garden.
meanings.sent5: He prenominated his travel destination months in advance.

meanings.definition: To name or designate before something occurs.
meanings.sent1: They prenominated the team captain for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent2: The company prenominated the project manager for the new initiative.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prenominated the biggest acorn in the tree as his own.
meanings.sent4: The rising star prenominated the lead role in the play.
meanings.sent5: She prenominated her successor in the leadership role.
